author: Cape Cod Times sports@capecodonline.com
title: Warriors clinch another ACL crown
text: Warriors clinch another ACL crown Upper Cape clinches tie for MAC Small title Comment Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 10:06 PM By Cape Cod Times Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 10:06 PM » Social News NORTH EASTHAM - The Nauset Warriors boys soccer team put the exclamation mark on their fifth straight Atlantic Coast League title with a dominant 3-0 win over the Marshfield Rams on Wednesday afternoon. With one league game remaining at Falmouth on Friday, Nauset (14-0, 7-0 ACL) has not lost a league match in the last three years. Junior Hayden Yakola tallied goals No. 23, 24 and 25 in the match, giving sophomore Conner Canesi all the offense he would need 30 minutes in. Yakola redirected a pass from sophomore Ethan Craven for the game’s first goal, staking the Warriors to a 1-0 lead at the half. Sophomore James McCully picked off a Marshfield pass just 20 seconds into the second half, finding Yakola for another score and a 2-0 advantage. Craven again assisted Yakola later in the half to ice the victory. Nauset got strong play on defense from freshman Abdel Talabi and sophomore Osdaiver Perez and in the midfield from senior Noah Casey. Upper Cape 6, Bristol Aggie 0: Six different players netted goals for the Rams, helping Upper Cape clinch a tie for the Mayflower Athletic Conference Small Division title in Dighton. Curran Baker, Ben Cardoso, Tyler Todesco, Luke Still, Jacob Cincott and Brendan Murray all scored for the Rams, now 10-2-3, 5-1 in the MAC Small. Upper Cape earned a tie for the league championship tie with Old Colony. The Cougars won their final league match, splitting the regulars season series with the Rams, as both teams finished 5-1 in the MAC Small. The Rams won the league title each of the last two season. Cincotta and Todesco added an assist each for Upper Cape while Cory Sullivan aided two goals. Kyle Carroll recorded his ninth shutout of the season, getting strong defensive support from Caleb Jepson, Brad Marcosa and Copeland Peacock. Sandwich 5, Falmouth 1: Ryan Beaton scored back-to-back unassisted goals to help the Blue Knights top the Clippers in East Sandwich. Dylan DeBettencourt’s goal from Christian O’Grady got Sandwich (5-9) on the board in the 13th minute. Beaton’s goals, in the 18th and 30th minutes, made it 3-0 Blue Knights. Falmouth (5-8-1) got on the board when Peter Dascombe-Olson scored with five minutes left in the first half, but Sandwich countered with two second-half goals. O’Grady drilled a penalty kick three minutes after halftime, then Dylan Klaiber scored off a pass from Josh MacLeod 19 minutes into the second half. Sandwich goalie James O'Brien made several key saves for Sandwich and kept the back line organized. By Cape Cod Times
